definition: to break in/to force a door
to lift/to pry open/to lever open

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The company possesses imported antitheft production line from foreign country.
sentences.chinese: 公司拥有国外进口的防撬门生产流水线。

sentences.english: When the burglars saw the police arriving they beat a hasty retreat.
sentences.chinese: 当那些撬门溜锁的看到警车到来，跑得比兔子还快。

definition: to pick a lock/to force a lock
to lift/to pry open/to lever open
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to break into a house when nobody is home
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
